discussion.content:

questions.question_text: Describe the structure of a Transfer Order.

choices.B: Transfer Order > Transfer Order Line > Transfer Order Task
choices.C: Transfer Order > Transfer Order Task > Transfer Order Line
choices.D: Transfer Order Task > Transfer Order Line

questions.question_text: When running an asset audit, you receive the result of 10 "Expected and not found" assets. What does this mean?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Expected and not found = Number of expected assets that weren’t scanned.
New = Number of assets that were scanned but don’t have a record in your ServiceNow instance.

Reference: https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/hardware-asset-management/reference/audit-results.html

Selected Answer: C
I would say C and D are both correct. In both cases, after your scan is complete, 10 items that were expected are not found. It doesn't matter if the other scanned items are in the instance or not.

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/hardware-asset-management/reference/audit-results.html

A: 10 scanned and expected
B: 10 scanned and expected; 10 scanned and not expected
C: 10 expected and not found; 10 scanned and not expected
D: 10 expected and not found; 10 new
=> both C and D have 10 expected and not found

The Answer should be C and not D. That an asset is in your ServiceNow instance doesn’t mean it is part of your audit. The only thing your audit should compare is asset you scanned vs what is your expected inventory list on the audit

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer

choices.C: You expected 10 assets in your inventory and scanned 10 assets during your audit, but none of them are on your expected inventory list.
choices.A: You expected 10 assets in your inventory and scanned these 10 assets during your audit.
choices.B: You scanned 20 assets in your inventory, but only 10 of them were on your expected inventory list.
choices.D: You expected 10 assets during your audit inventory and scanned 10 assets, but none of them have a record in your ServiceNow instance.

choices.B: State is In stock or Pending Delivery

questions.question_text: What requirements must be met in order for a consumable asset to be consumed? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADF
ADF is correct answer

Selected Answer: ADF
ADF, Verified using the HAM Now Learning course

Selected Answer: ADF
Page 176 HAMF Vancouver

Selected Answer: ADF
ADF 
As per NowLearing - Consumables: 
To consume consumable assets, they must have a Quantity > 0, have a state of In stock and a substate of Available.

Selected Answer: ADF
Verified using the HAM(f) Now Learning course.

Selected Answer: AB
AB is correct. Checked the link from Marka and it's all correct.

Selected Answer: AB
AB:
Transfer order line tasks are created to move transfer order lines from one stage to the other. Transfer order line tasks also help you to track service levels and the time frame needed to complete a transfer order.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-service-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/transfer-orders-asset.html

questions.question_text: What are the main purposes of transfer order line tasks? (Choose two.)

choices.D: To automate reordering of consumables as they are consumed by users
choices.C: To help track the total number of assets moved from one stockroom to another
choices.B: To move transfer order lines from one stage to another
choices.A: To help track service levels and the time frame needed to complete a transfer order
choices.E: To move transfer orders from one stage to another
